title: VR-Based Mining Safety Training Expert Course for K-12: Strengthening Social Responsibility and Civic Safety Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mining safety protocols and equipment operation experience, foundational understanding of social responsibility and public safety, and awareness of community collaboration systems
context.additional_context: A blended education program combining hands-on VR training modules with theoretical knowledge, utilizing simulations of real mining environments. Aims to establish a safety culture in industrial sites and enhance community safety awareness, including measures to protect citizens' rights and improve safety-related systems.

learning_goals: In a VR environment, learners will analyze virtual mining disaster scenarios, perform scientific evidence-based safety response procedures with over 90% accuracy, and propose practical measures to establish a citizen safety culture.

Learners will identify five major risk factors in mining workplaces (collapses, gas leaks, fires, etc.), explain prevention strategies from a social responsibility perspective, and discuss ways to enhance community safety awareness.
Through team-based projects, learners will design and evaluate VR training modules to improve mining safety protocols and contribute to developing citizen-participatory safety education programs.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
